jsslutils.sslcontext
Class X509SSLContextFactory

java.lang.Object
  jsslutils.sslcontext.SSLContextFactory
      jsslutils.sslcontext.X509SSLContextFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
PKIXSSLContextFactory, TrustAllClientsX509SSLContextFactory
public class X509SSLContextFactory
extends SSLContextFactory

This class is a factory that provides methods for creating an SSLContext configured with the settings set in this factory: using the SunX509 algorithm for both the key manager and the trust manager. These managers are created from the KeyStores passed to the constructor. Unlike the PKIX implementation, this implementation does not support CRLs.

Author:
Bruno Harbulot

Constructor Detail

X509SSLContextFactory

public X509SSLContextFactory(KeyStore keyStore,
                             String keyPassword,
                             KeyStore trustStore)
Builds an SSLContextFactory using the SunX509 algorithm in the TrustManagerFactory.

Parameters:
keyStore - KeyStore that contains the key.
keyPassword - password to the key.
trustStore - KeyStore that contains the trusted X.509 certificates.

setTrustManagerWrapper

public final void setTrustManagerWrapper(X509TrustManagerWrapper trustManagerWrapper)
                                  throws X509SSLContextFactory.LockedSettingsException
Sets the X509TrustManagerWrapper that will be used to wrap the trust managers returned by getRawTrustManagers() before being returned by getTrustManagers().

Parameters:
trustManagerWrapper - wrapper (may be null).
Throws:
X509SSLContextFactory.LockedSettingsException

Locks the trust manager wrapper so that it can no longer be set afterwards.

isTrustManagerWrapperLocked

public final boolean isTrustManagerWrapperLocked()
Checks whether-or-not the trust manager wrapper can still be changed.

Returns:
true if it's locked, false if it can be changed.
